text: It’s nice to have you back, Martha.
Thanks Doctor Kenner, I spent like, the last fifteen days in bed crying, out of bed crying, back in bed, so, here I am, here is me. Kenner nods and smiles.
And, how would you say you’re feeling now?
I guess I just feel...I don’t know. I'd want to say I feel betrayed, but is that, is that cliche?
No, it’s not cliche if it’s what you feel.
I just don’t want to hide behind pre- established ideas, I mean, I’ve been cheated on before.
I know, Daniel.
That's right, but this is different. (CONTINUED )
Do you feel Robert did something different? You were with him for just under a year.

It’s not that he did something different, I just...It was like he had another life. One woman, I could handle, it’d be fucked up, but I could handle it. (slowly sits up as she talks) But I mean...I have no idea, it’s scary, but I have no idea how many women he was sleeping with. And I mean, they weren't, I’ve seen them. They weren’t like, better than me.
Did you want them to be?
Well no, I just...I don’t know.
Do you feel like it’s your fault?
My fault?
Think about it. Martha sits thinking.

(shaking her head) No, NO, okay, no, I don’t feel that way. Why should I, I gave him everything, I trusted him, and then to go through his phone and find text messages about having anal sex in a hot tub? That’s what eleven months earned me? My fucking fault? Fuck that. Doctor Kenner looks uncomfortable.
But you know, maybe it is. It’s my fault for ever thinking this guy, this sycophantic, smarmy pretentious piece of self-involved dogshit could ever-
I think you’re being unfair, here. (CONTINUED)
(beat) What? Unfair to him? What? This awful unbelievable fucking asshole who acts like he wants to marry me and then every second we're apart is balls deep in some harem of washed out sluts-—

(adjusting her glasses) Sluts is a very strong term. I think you need to be a little understanding; Robbie is a very high pressure, intense individual and... Doctor Kenner trails off as she realizes that Martha is staring at her very, very intensely. DOCTOR KENNER (CONT’D) I... Martha leaps to her feet, grabbing a vase off the table n to the couch and hurling it at the wall next to Doctor Kenner.
(screaming)
The opening credits are juxtaposed with two different processes: the factory production of bullets and prescrip antidepressants/antipsychotics. COME BACK IN ON...

It’s a lot on the edge of the city, barely lit. The burni car sits in the center, and two other men stand a couple dozen feet away, by another car. VON Cartigan, late 30s, well dressed and handsome, with a spry, boyish look about him and cowboy boots, stands coun money in a briefcase on the trunk of the car. JOHNNY HOWL, stocky, 40s, with an eerie jack-o-lantern fa stands watching the car burn. Von looks at the money and tips his head to the side, thinking. (CONTINUED)
You think that was too much?
It’s never too much, Von.
Seemed a mite excessive, with his kid in the car.
He shouldn’t have brought his kid.
So it’s acceptable losses?
(beat) Yeah. Von closes the briefcase.
You’re a sick fuck, Johnny Howl.
(beat) Yeah. Von pops the trunk, and starts to put in the briefcase.
Hey Von. Von looks up, and Johnny nods at a badly burnt man, who’s crawling away from the car. Von laughs, and closes the trunk, then heads over to the crawling man.
Hello down there, Buddy. Rough night? The man lets out a hissing sound. Von stomps repeatedly on the back of the man’s knees with harsh cracking sounds. Von stops, and takes a breath.

Don’t crawl, Buddy, it’s undignified. (beat, then takes a moment, and smiles at Johnny) Johnny, help me put him back in the car. The man lets out a horrified groan as Johnny Howl approac smiling. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: THE BEEPING OF AN ALARM CLOCK.

text: INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM Martha’s alarm is going off, but her bed is empty. The ro is a mess, clothes everywhere, dirty glasses strewn here there. There is a diorama of the primeval world, old and tattered, spread across the wall, and a single wooden sculpture of a pterodactyl hanging from the ceiling. ELAINE Schiff, early 30s, tall and wiry, peeks in.
Martha, are you... Elaine comes into the room, looking around. There’s a lou thump from inside the closed closet.
(muffled) Shut up! Elaine looks concerned. INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT —- HALLWAY - LATER Elaine walks along, leading TATIANA Ruiz, early 30s, Cuba stout but pretty.
It’s as bad as I’ve seen her, Tati.
Where is she now? INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Elaine and Tatiana come in.
She’s drunk in the closet again. There’s a crashing sound from the closet. Tatiana sighs, goes over to the door.
Martha? Are you okay in there?
Amflegblamersh! JIHHHH! Tatiana looks to Elaine, who makes a “yikes” face. (CONTINUED)
I want to come in. Can I come in?
(inhuman demonic screaming) No0oocc00000000000000! Tatiana opens the door, revealing Martha laying in a pile fallen jackets, shirts and dresses. The closet is a wreck
(concerned) Oh Martha...What is this?
I’ve only been drinking for three...Days, but I haven’t missed work. I have missed work. Tatiana kneels down next to Martha.
Come on, honey, let’s-

I think you don’t know anything about this situation, you don’t know anything about the world...I’m gonna PUNCH YOU IN THE FACE...yourself...You better check yourself... Tatiana helps Martha up, near to against her will.
Elaine give me a hand.
(muttering) Checkyoself into a hospital...emergency room...after I mega...
I’m not touching her, she’s all...sticky.

(muttering) -..mega-punch... Martha collapses onto the floor.  INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT —- BATHROOM - SHORTLY THEREAFTER Martha’s bathroom is strictly whites and purples. She sta staring at herself in the mirror, squinting her eyes very hard, then staring again. She’s rocking in place a little

(quietly) Goddamn it. Martha brushes back her hair, and then stops, holding it back. She brushes the other side back, and then holds it She cocks her head, looking at herself. She opens a drawer, revealing a pair of electric clippers

Mr. RIGHT, 30, handsome with wavy, messy brown hair, walk the street. He has a lighter-than-air, poppy, bubbly air about him, as though he just walked out of a musical come He is constantly looking around, smiling blissfully and blankly at everything. Right stops in front of a tall building, checks the addre grins and goes in. We stay there on the lobby, and then shoot up the side of building around twenty stories, and stop at a window into nice apartment. A well dressed woman answers the door; it’s Right. He smiles, and they exchange words as he goes in. She looks very serious. Mr. Right looks hesitant. He seems to repeatedly, incredulous but friendly, ask the same questi The woman fervently nods. Mr. Right shrugs, pulls a red foam clown nose out of his pocket, puts it on, draws out a pistol and shoots her in heart. She falls down against the wall, startled. Right takes a contemplative bite of out a Rice-Krispie tr EXT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM Elaine is cleaning, while Tatianna talks on the phone. It getting dark outside. Martha abruptly bursts out of the bathroom; we see Elaine and Tatianna react sharply. Martha has cut off a good 85% of her hair. Martha tosses Elaine a pair of car keys.
Heads up. (CONTINUED)
The keys smack Elaine in the face, and she gasps, holding eye.
Martha, jesus christ.
I thought she would catch it with her mad skills. (beat, leans back) But, I guess she just kinda sucks. We’re going out, right? We’re going out.
The place is a little crowded; Elaine and Tatianna are at bar, they look nervous. Martha comes up, holding drinks; of the cups is empty, which she hands to Tatiana.
Hellloooo laaaadddiieeesss.
(to her empty cup) What the hell is this?
Well, it was supposed to be a sex on the beach but I drank it, so now it’s just a cup.
Jesus christ, Martha.

(excited, looking around) Oh, is he here? Martha separates from her friends, and goes off to dance. Out on the dance floor, Martha appears to be having a goo time dancing alone, when SOME GUY, mid-20s, reasonably attractive, approaches.
Hey!
(smiles) Hey!
Who are you here with? (CONTINUED)
My friends.
(laughs) No boyfriend? Martha abruptly stops dancing.
My boyfriend was killed by velociraptors.

What? (beat) Was that a joke? Martha looks very sad. SOME GUY (CONT’D) No, come on, it’s joke. Martha has started to cry. SOME GUY (CONT’D) Don’t do that...It was a joke...Don’t... Some Guy awkwardly moves back into the crowd, and Martha snickers, wiping her eyes.
Martha, Tatianna and Elaine walk up the road.
That was incredible!
How was that incredible?
It’s been forever since I’ve just been, you know, out like that, not trying to get laid.
You’re lucky we love you, Martie.
Yes I am! Hey, hoes before bros, right? (CONTINUED)
Martha offers out a fist.
Right? Am I right?
You’re out of control, girl. You are out of control. A car blurs by and we

In the near empty parking lot of a city zoo, a single expensive towncar sits alone, lights off, with heavily ti windows. A dozen feet or so away from the car stands SHOT STEVE Gage, late 20s, with a sly, wiry look about him, al like a human coyote. He lights a cigarette. Directly outside the car is BRUCE Cooper, 30s, black, lea and well dressed. He's trying to calm down CHARLIE Cartig who looks incensed.
Dead!? What the fuck do you mean, dead?
If you'd just get in the car, Mr. Cartigan, we could-

Fuck you, I’m not getting in the car, this ain’t a fuckin’ meet. If you want to wake a man up at three in the fuck AM you best have some kind of explanation, better than “Minkin is dead,” I don’t care who the fuck my nephews think they are- The driver’s side window rolls down, revealing RICHARD Cartigan, 42, bearing a distinct resemblance his brother and clearly trying to look dignified.
Charlie, get in the car.
What’re we doing here, Richard-
Get in the car. (CONTINUED)
Yeah, okay. The back door opens, and Richard gets in. Richard looks t Bruce, who rolls his eyes. Richard smiles, and rolls up t window.

Charlie gets in the back, looking around. Von sits in the passenger's side, and Johnny Howl sits in the back, playi with a Rubik’s cube. They all look nervous. There’s a charged silence. CHARLIE (CONT’D) What is this? (referencing Johnny Howl) What’s this ghoul doing here?
We have a problem.
Yeah, so I’ve fuckin’ heard, but it can’t wait till morning-
It might be my fault.
(exasperated) Are the Picolos involved in this? I thought they were all dead-
No, but it’s very, very serious.
So serious that we all might be in danger. Everyone’s quiet for a moment. Johnny Howl grins.
What did you do, Von? Von's silent.
(disgusted) You fuckin’ kids, playing at being gangsters-— (CONTINUED)
Johnny tak: 12.
Von took someone out, one of Yatsuda’s guys, and it looks like Yatsuda isn’t taking it well.
Why the fuck would you start shit with Bobby Yatsuda, are you fuckin’ suicidal?
He shitted us out on cash, Uncle Charlie. The dumbfuck shitted us out, big time, we couldn’t just let it stand.
Fuckin’ drugs? This was over fuckin’ drugs again?
Well-
It doesn’t matter what it was over.
No, I suppose it wouldn’t to you, would it. You know, Rich, I woulda seen this dumb shit coming from Von, I really would have. But you? Is this where you’re going too, with this garbage-
It doesn’t matter, Charlie, what matters is that we’re targets now. Von says he’s got some guys who can take care of this for us.
“Take care” of Bobby Yatsuda? Are you both out of your fucking minds?
Show him the list, Johnny. es out a rumpled list of phone numbers, handing it over to Charlie.
What's this?
It’s a list I made up; those are the numbers of the best trigger guys in the city. (CONTINUED)
What, we’re going to get some Slovakian douchebag to take down Bobby Yatsuda-
No, no, these aren’t thugs, man. These are the real deal, hitmen.
Hitmen? Shit, you guys are...Man, I ain't heard someone talking about hiring a real gun since the seventies.
Some of the numbers might not work, but if you can get a guy, then-
Why me?

The way Von figures it we’ve got a better chance of getting quality if we use you. No one gives a shit about Dickie and Von Cartigan, but Charles Cartigan, the Hammer, you’re a name. Charlie stares at the list.
You kids are really for real about this. Von looks nervously at Richard.
The way I see it, Von hasn't left us much of a choice. Charlie stares at the list.
It’s a petshop in a strip mall. There’s a loud shattering sound. CUT TO: A FURIOUS CAT’S SNARLING FACE.
In the kennel in the back of the store, a single longhair cat, deranged with fear and anger, has escaped from its carrier and knocked over a glass-fronted cabinet. (CONTINUED)
It sits in the center of the room, roaring furiously at Martha and Elaine, now dressed in work clothes, who stand facing it.
Isn’t it supposed to find a corner?
No, he wants to throwdown.
Cats aren’t supposed to throw down! The cat screams.
He wants to throw down pound for pound like we were clowns that tried to mess around.
What?
Gimme the net. Elaine gets a short-handled net from off a counter, and tosses it to Martha.
He‘’ll just run.
He wants to take me on, you want to take me on, come on ese I’1l cut you up! The cat screams with the fury of hell.

Oh you talk a big game now but not so big when I make you my bitch. (to Elaine) Go around back of him, startle him towards me. Elaine nods, and goes around back of the cat. Martha and cat lock eyes, and then Elaine jumps towards the cat.
Boo! The cat turns and pounces onto her face. (CONTINUED)
(rushing to help her) Oh shit!
Both women are sitting, covered in little bloody scratche and liquid cat diarrhea. Elaine is smoking a cigarette.
(continuing her thought) It just exploded.
Like a burst fire hydrant of cat shit, that was unreal.
Do you think that’s a defense mechanism, or-
I think he was just that scared of us. We're really hardcore.
How bad is the one on my elbow?
Oof. Bad. See this is why I’m never gonna be a lesbian. Elaine looks at her, confused.
Pussy is crazy dangerous. Elaine sits in silence, and then starts laughing.
You are, I think, actually retarded-
(standing up) Yeah yeah, I'ma hit the drugstore. Martha heads off. (CONTINUED)
It isn’t lunch yet!
(calling back) I know.
You're covered in blood and cat shit!
(from further yet away) I know.

Martha is waiting in line at the pharmacy, staring at a b “The Bahamas: Rediscover Love! Rediscover Life!” banner u on the wall. Mr. Right sits off to the side in the waiting area. He’s staring intently at his hands. People are kind of shying away from Martha, due to the smell and appearance, causin Right to notice her as she approaches the counter.
Name please?
Martha McKay.
Meflem?
Mick-AY.

Oh, yes. The pharmacist goes back to the medications. Martha glanc around, noticing Mr. Right STARING at her. Martha picks u her birth control, and turns, heading away from the pharm She glances back to Right, but he’s gone. She looks down, a little glum, and walks directly into a display of cough-drops; boxes scatter and fall in all directions. We see Martha’s POV, slow motion; as one of the boxes fal we see a dotted line draw out, predicting where it’s head Martha begins to reach out towards it. FREEZE. (CONTINUED)

Suddenly, every single falling box grows a prediction lin UNFREEZE. Martha catches the single box, but no other boxes fall. S looks up to see Mr. Right, holding all of the boxes. He looks earnestly cautious, as though he may have just viol a boundary.
(quietly) How did you do that.

(nods at the single box she holds) How did you do that? Martha stands silently for a moment. Right casually takes the box from her, and replaces them all on the display. S notices Right staring at her again.
It was a cat.
What?
A cat, did this.
Did what? Martha blinks, staring at him.
You want a lifesaver? Martha looks at him quizzically.
(reflective) I like lifesavers very much.
(beat) Do those work? Right just looks bewildered. (CONTINUED)
“Ooh, I'm nice lifesaver guy, you’re clumsy and vulnerable, look how handsome I am.” Do you have a secret stock of lifesaver based jokes? Do you buy them in bulk? Right stares at her emptily.
(blankly, as though by rote) I like lifesavers very much. Martha tries to move past him, and he blocks her way. Mar takes a step back, reevaluating the situation.
Is that creepy? Sometimes I don’t know when I’m being creepy. Right moves aside.
I get too forward, and then-
Who...are you?
Should I give you a fake name or my real one? Martha stares at him.
Fake name.
Hubert Cumberbund.
“Hubert Cumberbund.”
My friends call me Huey. Martha stares at him for a moment more and then laughs.
I can’t believe I’m talking to you, Huey.
(genuinely confused) But...it’s happening. (MORE) g (CONTINUED)
(beat) Do you wanna go get coffee? Like, hang out and stuff?
(laughs again) You are just...Why are you here?
(chipper ) I need my prescriptions so I don’t feel angry all the time.
I don’t think any one’s ever used that as pick-up line before.
(looks around, then whispers confidentially) Is it working?
(laughing and vehemently shaking her head) No, no it isn’t.
I’m sorry, it’s the best I’ve got. I’m not very suave.
Oh really?
No, not really, actually I am very suave.
(beat) Okay, explain why I should “hang out” with you in two words.
(beat) “Or else?” Martha stares at him, and then Right winks at her, and sh starts laughing. Right notices the circular box Martha is holding.
Oh, are those birth control? (beat) Awesome.  20.
Martha and Right sit together on the ground against the s of the restaurant. Both of them have kids’ meals in color cardboard containers, which they are opening.
What’d you get, what’d you get?
Hold on, hold on... (takes out her toy) Green Parrot. What’d you get?
Dog with Spot. Dog With Spot beats Green Parrot.
What? No way. Green Parrot can fly. (beat) Plus, he had this really bad childhood, so now he carries a knife with him everywhere. Right laughs.
His parole officer tries to send him in the right direction, but Green Parrot is just too... (laughs) What about Dog with Spot?
(shakes his head sadly) He had so much promise, but dropped out of college, lives with his girlfriend, she supports him...Not a pretty story, really.
Is this story indicative of you, or-
No, nah. So you were telling me about the museum?
Right, worked there for two years, and now, back to the petstore.
Wait, back to Petacular with Elaine? (CONTINUED)
Thus the cat shit, yes.
But I thought you said you were going to end up managing the Egyptian thing-
Right, I was, but I’m...People have trouble working with me.
Yeah? You're a troublemaker?
(grins) No, I just...I have some “restraint issues.” I’m kind of impulsive.
I find that really attractive.
Oh, you wouldn't if you knew me.
I’m impulsive too.
(beat) What do you do, exactly?
I sell cars, and I kill people.
Oh, you split the time?
(laughing) Seventy-thirty, sure.
Elaine stands alone behind the counter. She looks around, and then looks at the clock on the wall.
Martha and Right walk along the edge of an urban lake, laughing.
Dragons? (CONTINUED)

Yeah dragons. Humans put names on everything to make them safe, but when you come down to it, a whale is just a sea monster, right? I mean, what’s a dinosaur other than a dragon? As Martha talks, an errant frisbee nearly hits Right; seemingly without even looking, he catches it and throws back. Martha lau
People see things and they put labels on them, and it takes the...The whatever, the wonder out. It allows people to just glance at stuff instead of really looking.
People prefer that, I think. Most people live in little contained worlds; they like a T-Rex better as a big bunch of bones than as something that actually lived.
Yeah, maybe. That’s why I got into paleontology in the first place, because I wanted to show the past to people in a new way. I thought by now I’d be working in the Smithsonian, but I can’t...
Impulsive, right.
Right. (beat) We haven’t really, yknow, talked about you much.
Well that’s a shame, because I’m very, very interesting. ghs, but then they’re interrupted by a CHONGA, early twenties, latina, sexy, who stands with her friends around a picnic table in the park.
Hey, hey wifey! (CONTINUED)
Yeah, can I help you?
Ain’t you know Robbie Hewitt?
(slowly) Yeah... The chonga says something to her friends, and they all la
Well you tell him he need to call me back, because- The chonga notices that Martha is charging at her, scream and looking crazy.
CARTIGAN’S BROWNSTONE

INT. CHARLIE CARTIGAN’S PLACE - LIVING ROOM Charlie Cartigan sits alone in his living room, staring a the crumpled list Von gave him. He sighs, and dials one o the numbers. It’s disconnected. He tries another, and it’ again disconnected. CUT TO: SAME, LATER. Charlie’s on the phone with Von. We intercut back and for to Von, who’s in an ARCADE playing a stand-up video game while Johnny Howl sits on a pinball machine behind him.
The numbers don’t work.
How many did you try?
I tried six, they’re all disconnected-
Well I told you some of them wouldn’t work, Uncle Charlie, you’ve just gotta go till you get one. These are the best around, they don’t stay in the same place for long, right? (CONTINUED)
Right, I guess, but I’m supposed to go through every number here?
Well what was I supposed to do, call and then hang up if they answer? That’s a good way to get myself shot- Von dies in the game, causing Johnny Howl to chuckle.
Agh, goddamnit!
(concerned) You okay?
Look, I’m fine, Charlie, and I’m sorry about the numbers, but just please, do your best, okay? Von hangs up as a big, bulky ARCADE EMPLOYEE comes up to Johnny Howl.
Hey, man, please don’t sit on the machines. Johnny Howl looks to Von.

Yeah, I’m done anyway. Johnny Howl abruptly spins around behind the bulky guy, a instantly slits his throat with a straight razor. Blood splatters onto the pinball machine, and the man fal behind it. It all happened so fast, no one in the arcade even noticed. Von chuckles.
Let's go.
No, I wanted to-
Let's go. BACK TO: CHARLIE CARTIGAN’S APARTMENT —- LATER (CONTINUED)
Charlie hangs up his phone, crossing off another number, frustrated. He sighs, and dials again. CUT TO: RIVERSIDE WALKWAY.
Mr. Right and Martha are posted out down by the water, relaxing. Night has fallen, and the park is lit by street lamps. Martha is even further mussed. Right’s cell phone rings, and he flips it open.
Anyone interesting?
Probably not. Right flips the cell phone closed again.
I’ve never, I don’t think I’ve ever seen a woman throw punches like that before.
Yeah, well, she escaped, so mission failure, I think.
She was one of the girls sleeping with...
Yeah.

I don’t get that. I mean, if you’re ina relationship, you’ve got to be locked down. I don’t even know how someone starts into something, why they would start into something if they didn’t know right then and there they wanted to commit. Martha smiles, and looks down. (CONTINUED)

See, I think my problem has always been that if you want someone, really want them, you’ve got to know immediately and stick by it. Recently, I don’t want to throw myself out there for anyone to pick up. I’ve just been trying to take life more seriously, you know? Martha looks up, and gasps, then laughs; Mr. Right has pu the red foam clown nose. He takes it off, pocketing it.
The corniest guy alive.
It's possible.
So, are you against casual sex, then?
I don’t think I’ve ever had sex that wasn’t casual; I mean, I usually do it naked, so what’s more casual than that. Martha laughs.
I was dating a girl, for a while, and we were having formal sex; I had to wear a tuxedo. It was really sweaty- Martha keeps laughing.
And I dated a girl where we had, like, semi-formal sex; I had to wear a button up. Condom. Martha grabs Right and kisses him.
INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT - HALLWAY - SOON AFTER Right and Martha crash into the apartment hallway, still making out. Elaine peeks her head out from her room. (CONTINUED)
Oh, uh, hello. Martha ducks off into her room.
(muttering, embarrassed) Oh, uh, my hair...
(to Elaine) Hello Elaine!
Have we...met?
(cheery) No! Elaine stares at him.
I’m in love with Martha. You and me are going to be friends! Elaine quietly goes back into her room, shutting the door She opens the door again for a moment, staring at him. Mr Right sort of shrugs.

INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM The lights are off. Mr. Right lays on the bed, shoes and socks off, flipping through the channels. He stops, stari at the diorama on the wall. Martha comes out of the bathroom in a towel, with a towel around her hair. She notices Right staring at the diorama and looks at him questioningly.
(by way of clarification) Dragons. Martha has to stop a frighteningly big smile, and then co her face, slightly embarrassed.
(smiles) It’s cool. (CONTINUED)
She and Mr. Right stare at each other for a moment, and t she crawls out onto the bed, and lays down next to him.
If we don’t... Mr. Right just looks at her, and shrugs.
I mean, will you still stay? Mr. Right smiles, and then nods. She kisses him gently on the lips.

head_text.subj: THE DISTANCE SIGHTS OF A BINOCULARS COME UP, AND WE SEE M

text: Across the street on the roof of a building, Agent Bart HOPPER, 54, with a widows peak, looks down at Martha’s wi through binoculars. Next to him, Agent WALLY Kinokis, 30, gruff looking, pops open a pack of nicotine gum. Both of them, from their clothes to their posture, read as FBI.
They fucking?
(beat) Nope.
You think he’s gonna kill her?
I don’t know.
Yeah, but you must have a theory-
Does chewing that gum help you at all?
(beat) Yeah.

Then chew the damn gum. Wally shrugs.  29. INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM —- MORNING Martha lays asleep, alone, in bed; her towel has come mos unwrapped, and we can see her bare back and a little bit her butt. She blinks, awaking and realizing she’s alone, then notices a note on her bed. Drawn on it is a simple, childlike image of Martha fighti cat like a lion tamer, with stiff block letters under it. HAVE TO GO TO WORK. I WILL SEE YOU TONIGHT.” She stares a it for a moment, and then slowly allows herself to smile. INT. CAR DEALERSHIP - RIGHT’S OFFICE Right sits at his desk, talking on the phone, looking out window. The nameplate reads “Clark Speck.” There’s a wind up toy on his desk, wandering along.

No, I see the convertibles. (listens) I see them, I do, but you have to understand, when I say we can’t move convertibles I mean we can’t move convertibles, I’m not going to make up a sales problem, here. Someone walks by, and he covers the phone, calling out to them.
Mitch, hey Mitch! The man stops and looks into the office.
I’m in love! Mitch shrugs, and keeps walking. Right goes back to the phone.

Look, I’ll get back to you about this on Tuesday, okay? Okay. Right. Okay. Mr. Right hangs up, and sits for a moment, and then takes his cell phone. It reads “ONE NEW VOICEMAIL.” Right, making the strange, dead face, presses send.  30.
Elaine and Martha are loading crates of Kitty Litter up o the shelves.
an ou ire someone Oo oO 1s? Can't you hi to do this?
I did, I hired you.
Yeah, but someone to do it for us, while we watched. Elaine just shakes her head.
Why did Busta sleep in my room last night?
It was weird, he wouldn’t come in while... (laughs) I just realized I don’t know his real name.
Who, Mr. Right?
Mm, I like that.
You slept with him and you don’t even know his-
I slept with him, I didn’t screw him-
You don’t even know his name? Martha’s quiet.
And Busta wouldn’t come in...You know, they say animals can sense evil. Martha glares at her. (CONTINUED)
He’s not “evil.” Ooh, actually, what if he is? I hope he is. Martha lifts a big crate of cat litter up onto the shelf.

Monster?

You want to call me “Monster?”

Monsta.
Better than Agatha.

Martha Agatha, I sound like I was born an old lady.
I like old ladies. The way they smell, the way their skin feels. You know, when I kiss you, I just, I feel like I’m making out with my grandma, and it just turns me on so much I can’t even stand it-
(laughing) Oh my god, stop it, stop it. Right smiles.
You’re so...hot. Martha blinks.
I want to come around the table and sit next to you, can I do that?
What?
I want to come around-

No, I...I think you should definitely do that. Break the face to face code of table dining. Right laughs, and moves his chair around the table so he next to her. The food arrives, and the confused waiter pu the plates down in front of them. (CONTINUED)

Right looks up, and catches Martha staring at him. She coughs, and looks down at her food. INT. RIGHT’S APARTMENT - LATER Right's apartment is primarily decorated in greens, taste very organized, minimalist. Martha sits on his couch, looking around. Right is in the kitchen, making hot chocolate.
(calling to him) What’s your name?
(spraying whipcream onto the hot chocolate) My name?
Yeah, I was, I was enjoying the whole not knowing thing, but I mean, I feel like it’s done now. Right comes over to her, and hands her her mug of hot chocolate.

The truth is, I don’t really like my name. I kind of hate it. Even hearing it makes me kind of angry, I...I have a lot of anger about a lot of things. I’m kind of messed up in a lot of ways. I've been completely honest with you about everything, it’s only two days in so I know that’s not a big accomplishment or something, but I just...I really don’t like my name. I don’t want to tell you it, because I don’t want to hear you say it. Martha stares at him.
How did you do that thing in the store.
What thing?
You moved...the way you move sometimes. Like you already know how things are going to- (CONTINUED)
(a little self-conscious) Oh, right. That.
Is this a thing?
No, it’s... Martha waits. Right seems to think for a moment.
It's a little later, and Martha and Right now stand next his table. Martha looks a little apprehensive.
(straightening out the knives) I’ve always found it easier to show, rather than just try to explain-
Is this going to get, like, scary?
No scarier than usual, I don’t think.
There aren’t usually knives.
You never play with knives?

A quick montage of Martha playing with knives in various locations; frightening Tatianna, twirling them clumsily i front of a mirror, running one up her arm and getting the shivers, violently and theatrically slicing an onion “HIY HIYA!” and finally 80s home video footage of Little Marth running holding a bunch of knives yelling “I GOT KNIFES F FINGAHZ!" with her frantic father chasing after her, stop for a moment to turn to the camera and shout “Christy put camera down!”
MARTHA’S (CONTINUED)
Not really.
First time for everything. Martha smiles nervously.

It's slightly later; Right and Martha are nearer to the center of the room. Right stands behind their bodies pres together, limbs moving slowly, synchronized, just an easy gradual dance. As they move, Right talks.
Ever since I was a little boy, I’ve had an idea. It’s a theory. (he leans back, forcing her to lay back on him, and runs her own hands up her body) Keep up.
(trying to keep her balance) I’m trying.

Everything we see, like physical things, it’s all just islands. And under it, carrying it, is this sweeping current. He brings their right hands up in front of Martha’s face, moves it fluidly back and forth.

And if you pay attention, you can start to feel it. Here, you see how your hand moves with mine? You can feel it. You can feel it through me. Do you feel it? Martha’s quiet as they move, trying to figure out if this just foreplay, or if that strange sensation she’s feeling counts at what Right is talking about. He subtly grabs a knife off the table with his left hand, and then continue moving, bringing the knife dangerously close to her throa (CONTINUED)
(a little afraid, staring at the knife) I...uh...

It's okay, just concentrate on the knife. (beat) Now if we can feel the current, we can feel other things in the current, other moving things, people...watch the knife...And we can feel how the current will move them, and we can see where they’1l go. It’s all in the movement, see, it pushes itself; it’s easier to move with it than against it. Martha’s gaze moves from knife to Right’s arm, and, very faintly, we see the dotted trace lines from his shoulder, elbow, his wrist and the tip of the knife. Right, staring at Martha, watching her face, abruptly drops the knife, brin his and her other hands directly under it. Martha yelps and jumps away, and Right easily catches kni

Why the fuck would you-

Catch it, jesus-

You could’ve cut me- (CONTINUED)

I can't catch a knife-

I could tell you can feel it. You don’t know how yet, but I can keep showing you, I-
No, really- (picking up her purse) That’s great, but I need to leave, now, and I- towards the door-
-think it would be better off if we just took a day or-
But you felt it!
It doesn’t matter what I-
Martha. (CONTINUED)

(whispering) That’s so gnarly- Mr. Right tosses another knife at her, and Martha catches almost without looking.
No, no more, okay, it...I get it.

No, I mean, like, immediately. They stand there staring at each other. INT. RIGHT’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - MORNING Martha and Right lay in bed together, naked. Mr. Right is asleep. Martha is awake, staring straight ahead, a blank, happy smile on her face.

Martha stands in Mr. Right’s bathroom, naked, looking at prescription medication bottles. None of them have labels She gives them a cursory examination, and then looks at h toothbrush, his deodorant, and then his shaving razor. She is quietly, serenely happy.

INT. MR. RIGHT’S CAR - SHORTLY THEREAFTER Mr. Right is driving, with Martha next to him. They’re bo quiet and happy. They come to a red light, and Mr. Right notices the car’s clock; 9:43 AM.

Are you the guy? (CONTINUED)

Well, I don’t...What’re you- 43. an Right sighs and impatiently tears open the envelope. Insi is picture of BOBBY YATSUDA, a vicious looking Asian Amer man in his 50s, along with some documents.
Him?

This Bobby Yatusda, you want me to kill Bobby Yatsuda?
Well, jesus, I don’t... (looks around, baffled) Uh...Is this a-
It's not a trick. It’s not a game. You want me to kill this man.
-..Yes? Mr. Right gives a somewhat sad smile.

Okay. Martha watches from the car as Right and Charlie stand up shake hands. Mr. Right then puts on the clown nose. Charlie looks confused. I...Well, I was going to do that an ay.. yway (MORE) (CONTINUED)

MARTHA’S APARTMENT - HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS Martha comes in, closes the door, leans and then slumps against it, staring straight ahead. We see her view of th apartment, empty and hostile. (CONTINUED)

Von you shut him up or I swear to god-
Howl, shut your mouth. Johnny makes a big show of being quiet.
It’s Yatsuda, it must be.
How did he know?
He’s Bobby fucking Yatsuda-
And I’m Richard Fucking Cartigan, who the fuck are you, Von? This is on your head; you’ve been trouble ever since you came back to us from the Picolos. Von looks hurt.
Why would Yatsuda hire a contractor?
What?
I mean, we haven’t felt any backlash from Yatsuda himself, why would he hire some random gun to take out- (CONTINUED)
Who gives a shit, Bruce? We go get this guy, eye for an eye, yeah? Bruce looks annoyed, and Richard sits, thinking.

(emotional) Get some guys. Take him out. Tonight. Do it. Von and Johnny briefly make eye contact, and then Johnny nods. INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - LATER Martha sits on her toilet, not moving. There’s a knock at the door, which she ignores. Another knock, harder. OUT IN THE HALLWAY. (hurriedly) -Agent Kinokis-

This thing is from like world war fucking one, you said this guy was some kinda super sonic psycho killer and I’m going to go out fucking duck hunting-

S'just-

I need Zeke here with me. Just shut your mouth, do your job, or I’1l cut your fucking cheeks out, yeah? Steve is reluctantly quiet.  49. INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT —- LIVING ROOM Martha sits motionless at a eaves-table; Elaine is pacing behind her, looking shaky. Hopper is seated across from h and Wally stands behind him; Hopper’s open briefcase sits a chair next to him.
He’s...he’s not a bad person. Hopper laughs.
You don’t even know what he is, who he is-
(interrupting her) His name is Francis Minch. He’s a psychopath. Hopper spreads some photos out on the table, mugshots, ne photographs of assassinations.

He was formerly one of the world’s most notorious professional killers. He had been ever since he was a teenager, just a kind of meat-grinder of a man. But then, about a year ago, he had a nervous breakdown and quit.
Why?

(cutting off Hopper) He’s a psychopath, not a sociopath. The guy has emotions. He has guilt. They’re just operating on a real low level, and his “feelings” just finally caught up with him. (beat, a look from Hopper) That’s the theory, anyway.
(quietly) Then what was today?
What?

After a beat, Hopper smiles an odd smile.
After the breakdown, Minch developed a kind of moral code. He’s still notorious. People still try to hire him. But now, he kills them.
He kills the people who hire him?
That’s right.
Because “murder” is wrong.
That’s insane.
So is Francis Minch. Martha and Elaine are silent.
Just how dangerous is he?

Oh, there’s no kind of chart. Minch isn’t some kind of superhero, he’s as human as you and me, he’s just...He’s just frighteningly efficient. He dances in, kills everyone, and dances out. (to himself, ponderous) It's kind of beautiful, really. 50. A long beat. Martha and Hopper have made eye contact, and there’s an odd kind of understanding. Elaine and Wally lo distinctly non-plussed.
(quietly) So what now.

(standing) The man you witnessed him killing today was heavily involved in organized crime. We should expect retribution. We're arranging a safe-house for you; until then, we’re putting this apartment under protection. (CONTINUED)
If he makes any attempt to contact you, you talk to us immediately, right? Martha just sits there, still shell-shocked.
Right. She’s got it. Martha stares at nothing.
Mr. Right is locking up, and waving goodbye to coworkers they leave. He begins to walk alone through the lot, and then takes out his cell phone, dialing Martha.

Steve shoves down Uzi’s gun by the barrel, burning his ha

Agh, shit, STOP FUCKING SHOOTING! Right crouches down, and slowly, carefully starts squat- walking through the row of cars. He looks agitated, but n scared or nervous. Out in the circle, Shotgun Steve, Uzi and SAW look around very quietly. The car alarm screams in the night. (CONTINUED)
Where’d he go?
(quietly) God fucking damn it, why did you start shooting-
Shut up, pussy, I didn’t see you doing jack shit and- Shotgun Steve abruptly raises his hand.

Shh-sh-shh. The car alarm keeps going off into the night. Ah man; all right, let’s get out of here. There are two more thumps, and two more sirens start as t men slowly begin to back out of the maze of cars.

(whispers) Martha. INT. MARTHA’S APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY Hopper stands outside of Martha’s apartment door, not mov The door creaks open, and Martha peers out. He looks at h

Hi.

Right launches one of his spring-loaded pistols into a ma face, catches it as it bounces off, trips a man behind hi shoots him, shoots the guy whose face got bounced, blasts man behind him in the chest with the shotgun, and then ho the shotgun out, butt first, to the gunless thug who originally had the shotgun. (annoyed)

Here, sit down. They sit down together.
Just take long, deep breaths, in through the mouth, out through the nose. Bruce nods and tries to regain control over his breathing

I was going to shoot you, but then you pulled out that grenade and I was like, look at the size of the balls on this gu- The doors of the room burst open, and eight men wielding different varieties of assault rifles burst in; Steve’s reenforcements. Time seems to freeze. (CONTINUED)

We see through Mr. Right’s POV as what looks like permane marker draws a “game-plan” on the men, numbering them and crossing them off, drawing curved lines to represent when how they will raise their guns. Before they can even fire a shot Right stands and fires seemingly without aiming, bang bang bang bang bang bang b going through the men like a shooting gallery, leaving on one man standing as Right runs out of ammunition; he was ducked down when they came in, and ran behind his compatriots. Oh hey, you got me again! Right gracefully lurches left, and Steve fires, but Right already lightning quick drawn a Deringer and fires a shot that plinks off Steve’s rifle, knocking it out of his han Right straightens up as though nothing happened.

(less friendly) Get over here. Steve quickly gets up and goes over to Bruce and Right, whereupon Right starts smiling again.
Bruce, do you know Steve? Bruce nods. Right sits Steve down next to Bruce. (CONTINUED)
(to Steve, quietly) Bruce has just had a really rough experience, so I'd appreciate it if you could sit and keep him company till I get back. Um, if I get back.

Radical, thanks dude. Right smiles, and then races off through the doors and ou sight. Steve and Bruce sit in silence, and then Steve turns and looks at the bodies of the other goons. He let’s out a muffled nervous chuckle, and then Bruce starts laughing. They sit there laughing together.

You just like me tied up. Right shrugs, smiling, and then starts cutting her free. INT. THE CARTIGAN LODGE - RICHARD’S OFFICE Richard comes in, only to find Von pouring gasoline out o can onto everything in the office.

You fucking idiot. (beat) You are a FUCKING IDIOT, you know that 95. the wall, Richie? Smart Richie Cartigan protecting his brother, smart Richie Cartigan gonna be head of the family, smart Richie Cartigan always in control, and I fucked up. Even now, I fucked up. Richard stares at Von.

Out front, the cars out front, right, right. Von yanks her along as they head out.

I shot Von Cartigan.

Yeah. They kiss again. Bruce looks to Shotgun Steve, and mouths “These people are fucking crazy." Steve smiles.

Just look, look, here. Elaine snatches up the thing off the table, and holds it to Tatiana. It’s a picture of an old style gothic cathedr she flips it over. “HO’S BEFORE BROS. LOVE, THE FUGITIVE. (CONTINUED)

Steve looks good; he’s had a haircut and a shave, and wea tailored jacket.
Steven Bradley Gage. The projector clicks, and now displays an equally well- dressed/groomed picture of Bruce.

Bruce Christopher Cooper. INT. FBI BRIEFING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Hopper, his arm in a sling, stands in front of a large projection screen in a room full of agents. Wally stands the back, chewing his gum, leaning on a crutch. The slide change according to what Hopper discusses.

These two men, within the last month, have settled into controlling positions of what was formerly the Cartigan Crime Syndicate. Now, their rise to these positions was of course facilitated by the massacre at the Cartigan estate in Bonville, where Francis Minch and Martha McKay evaded capture after killing all remaining members of the Cartigan family. Now, as you know, the immediate capture of Minch and McKay is the priority of this task force, and over the next couple of weeks we’re going to learn everything we can about them. (beat) As most of you know, I’ve been demoted to advisory status on this case, so for a more complete briefing on the situation, and our pursuit strategy, I’m going to direct you upstairs to Agent Hirschfeld. All the agents nod and start putting away their things. Hopper looks sad.  105.

It’s the main entrance hall of a new museum; the exhibits still being constructed. Martha, her hair grown out a lit and dyed black, is sitting up on a scaffold, directing Czechoslovakians as they assemble a Tyrannosaurus.
The jaw! His jaw is too high.
Miss Cumberbund, how do we-
Just turn the screw on the side. There, you got it; yeah. Do you recognize the shape of a head, sort of? You know where the mouth would go on a head?
-..On the bottom?
Oy...okay, just move the jaw into the crater sockets and you should be-
Martha. Martha looks down and grins. Mr. Right waits for her by t front desk. Martha rushes down off the scaffold, and embraces him.
Hey babe, I thought you were at work-
Lunch break. I wanted to give you this. (quickly, quietly) I drew you this picture of a dinosaur. He hands her a picture of a dinosaur he drew her; it show her leading a tyrannosaurus by a leash.
(sincere) Oh, this is so gnarly.
Okay, I'll see you at five, yeah?
Yeah. (CONTINUED)
There’s a crash from behind them, and Right quietly bows Hopper is

It's Rowley’s fault! He dropped the jaw, and we’ve been putting it together for hours without-
You guys, you guys... (beat, composes herself) T-Rex’s are totally awesome. Can we please try to remember how totally unbelievably cool it is that we get to build a T-Rex?
(quietly, looking at the skeleton) This is pretty cool.
Yeah. (smiles) Now pick up the jaw.
cleaning up his presentation area, when a young agent approaches him.
Hey, Agent Hopper-

I was wondering if you'd be willing to give me your own thoughts on the Francis Minch situation.
Well-
off the record.
(smiles) Off the record. Right. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
Well, I think we’ve got it all backwards. I don’t think he’s on the run.

I think he probably just took McKay, flew somewhere he wanted to be and they’ve set up shop like nothing’s wrong. I think he’s in love, and he’s done with organized crime for now; he’s probably selling cars, a travel agent, I don’t know. (noticing Right) The fuck are you looking at? You want to get it like these two faggots? Keep walking!
